intro: Chaetogastra sarmentosa, commonly known as the creeping chaetogastra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its sprawling growth habit, with prostrate stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread across the ground. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it is often found in moist, shaded environments.
